bug.author: wecacuee
bug.summary: [Bug] CatLazyTensor fails matrix multiplication on Rectangular InterpolatedLazyTensors
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
CatLazyTensor fails matrix multiplication on Rectangular InterpolatedLazyTensors. I think the bug is withing InterpolatedLazyTensors. <denchmark-h:h2>To reproduce</denchmark-h>
** Code snippet to reproduce ** import torch from gpytorch.lazy import InterpolatedLazyTensor, NonLazyTensor, CatLazyTensor
catlzt = CatLazyTensor( InterpolatedLazyTensor(NonLazyTensor(torch.rand(4, 2)), left_interp_indices=torch.arange(4).reshape(4,1), left_interp_values=torch.ones((4,1)), right_interp_indices=torch.arange(2).reshape(2,1), right_interp_values=torch.ones((2,1))), InterpolatedLazyTensor(NonLazyTensor(torch.rand(2, 2)), left_interp_indices=torch.arange(2).reshape(2,1), left_interp_values=torch.ones((2,1)), right_interp_indices=torch.arange(2).reshape(2,1), right_interp_values=torch.ones((2,1)))) res = catlzt @ torch.eye(2) assert res.shape == (6, 2) ** Stack trace/error message ** <denchmark-code> File "<ipython-input-5-d4b789a61558>", line 15, in <module> res = catlzt @ torch.eye(2) File "/home/vdhiman/wrk/gpytorch/gpytorch/lazy/lazy_tensor.py", line 1731, in __matmul__ return self.matmul(other) File "/home/vdhiman/wrk/gpytorch/gpytorch/lazy/lazy_tensor.py", line 1098, in matmul return func.apply(self.representation_tree(), other, *self.representation()) File "/home/vdhiman/wrk/gpytorch/gpytorch/functions/_matmul.py", line 20, in forward res = lazy_tsr._matmul(rhs) File "/home/vdhiman/wrk/gpytorch/gpytorch/lazy/cat_lazy_tensor.py", line 244, in _matmul for t, rhs in zip(self.lazy_tensors, rhs_)] File "/home/vdhiman/wrk/gpytorch/gpytorch/lazy/cat_lazy_tensor.py", line 244, in <listcomp> for t, rhs in zip(self.lazy_tensors, rhs_)] File "/home/vdhiman/wrk/gpytorch/gpytorch/lazy/interpolated_lazy_tensor.py", line 159, in _matmul left_interp_t = self._sparse_left_interp_t(self.left_interp_indices, self.left_interp_values) File "/home/vdhiman/wrk/gpytorch/gpytorch/lazy/interpolated_lazy_tensor.py", line 311, in _sparse_left_interp_t left_interp_indices_tensor, left_interp_values_tensor, self.base_lazy_tensor.size()[-1] File "/home/vdhiman/wrk/gpytorch/gpytorch/utils/sparse.py", line 61, in make_sparse_from_indices_and_values res = cls(index_tensor, value_tensor, interp_size) RuntimeError: size is inconsistent with indices: for dim 0, size is 2 but found index 3
</denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected Behavior</denchmark-h>
Expect the matrix multiplication to succeed <denchmark-h:h2>System information</denchmark-h>
Please complete the following information:
GPyTorch Version origin/master (v0.3.5) PyTorch Version 1.2 Ubuntu 16.04
<denchmark-h:h2>Additional information</denchmark-h>
Probably related to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cornellius-gp/gpytorch/issues/900>#900</denchmark-link>
